body: It seems there are two **"\n"** new line symbols accidentally missing from **line 2314 andd 2315** of the code for the current **runEergySimulation** component. This causes the "zone ideal loads supply air total cooling energy" variable tangled with other output variables in one line in the idf file: 1. current code of **line 2314 andd 2315**: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/zMKTheYTK0ogVwnbuB3NGhZNkIdLefZXjy4vqY9c9tCAf28e9TcxQXCnlx5G8bukBj0ZmU*W-dR7g85a4gn1*Z-vYXzk0Brp/ScreenShot20170423at5.20.48PM.png) 2. current output variable section in the idf file: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/zMKTheYTK0qaCkrOJ7BcvYWptYCfW4EpOuWY7NwIiI3B61PXbU9xc4VTIQ9OjvSP6sj76h7XEJ4hK5h4HKS18jhOwng4QIQW/Image1.png) 3. revised code with the "\n" new line symbol added: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/zMKTheYTK0pBN0zLwdFAj62vkSNTECFI49d*E7ZAbXpUmozvz0xAf3hJXxhKKdmQIMPYD6bRiacbLx8-Vgi8T3EefBuB0mLo/ScreenShot20170423at5.22.24PM.png) 4. correct IDF file with the cooling loads outpu variable in a separate line: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/zMKTheYTK0pA3DGvKVwJxl-aS9FnUHM3sgK6NlmDFQllWSO63BO7AZNBkJ1GIX2A*75RLvNDM6*0Qk0t-Qt6qkTTfmt0LX9m/Image2.png) 5. cooling loads can now be correctly calculated and read: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/zMKTheYTK0pUoASD10tFlVlX8onV*53bq5TBd*yd*0S1lm21AE-gVZ3mgUjKmgX07sE1yDzGSRnv5K1GokebgKX5Ug7ikh83/Image5.png) Please kindly verify if this is the source of issue, and if this is the case, I'd appreciate if the current runEP component can be updated. Thanks. - Ji.
